channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024120248
item.description:
Report E-2024120248

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-27T01:03:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately seven (7) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to the drum being punctured by a forklift. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120354
item.description:
Report E-2024120354

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured by a nail and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew broke down the impacted skid and utilized absorbents and cleaning agent to remove all paint from the surfaces. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

This caused approximately 3 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. An environmental contractor was dispatched to the scene to handle the remediation.

item.title: Report I-2024120045
item.description:
Report I-2024120045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRADEBE TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PART VI- DESCRIPTION OF EVENTS & PACKAGE FAILURE Describe the sequence of events that led to the incident and the actions taken at the time it was discovered. Describe the package failure, including the size: and location of notes, cracks, etc. Photographs and diagramÂ· should be submitted if needed for darif cstlon. Estimate the duration of the release, If possible. Describe what was done to mitigate the effect of the release. Continue on additional sheets if necessary. It was discovered at the transfer yard that one of the drums was Leaking, approximately 20 gallons of Waste Flammable Resin Solution had leaked from one of the drums Inside the trailer. The driver immediately used his spill kit to clean up the spill and overpacked the drum. It was determined that when the drum was being loaded using th6 forklift attachment "drum it damaged the drum and caused the leak.
